text: welcome to the developing leaders series
my name is Miriam McLemore former
corporate CIO at the coca-cola company
and now enterprise strategist with AWS
where I partner with leaders globally to
enable business transformation we have
invited leaders from around the world
and across industries to share their
insights on leadership vision strategy
and people development Morgan thank you
so much for being here today thanks for
having me I'd like to start our
conversation and learn a little bit
about how you identify leaders in your
organization well whether we look for
them internally or externally the two
biggest things I look for regardless of
what positions were hiring for but
especially at the leadership level is
culture fit and attitude we really need
to make sure that their their customer
focused their high energy and they can
communicate the technological ideas with
people skills and and make that
connection
so how do you get them the experience
that they need to lead in your
organization so we've had about 50/50
bringing leaders in from the outside
because we realized when I first took
over the state we didn't have certain
leaders for certain positions so we did
need to import but otherwise you know
proving themselves giving them projects
giving them stretch goals and seeing how
they perform we actually have been
doubling down on some new technologies
and having to bring in leaders to do
things that the state's never done one
position we actually brought in somebody
from another business unit that had the
right attitude the right background but
they hadn't done this specific project
yet but nobody else had so we gave her a
chance and she's actually been one of
our superstars and it's kind of raised
the bar of what we expect from other
leaders because now we have somebody
that's doing this you know everybody
should be able to at least go at that
same pace in another area their cloud
operations you know being a government
organization we weren't the most cutting
edge yeah so we had to bring somebody in

actually transformed organizations and
he's been a rising star an organization
somebody that within the first year
we're looking at promoting and having
junior leaders underneath him that can
from him having those new leaders in
there has that brought up the rest of

allowed us to look at some of our other
leaders and you know whether it's hi
holding them to a higher account or

some adjustments moving people around in

successful some folks have exited our

any organization some people can't keep
up as you raise the bar and as you set
new goals but for the most part we have
a really great leadership team people
that whether they're customers of our
stakeholders partners they've seen how
what it's been like to work for the
state and that's attracted talent we
have people coming to us asking you know
do you guys have openings or I'd love to

it's it's been a good message because

yeah the ones all disrupted and we run

cybersecurity controls that on top of
that network the human resource system
people log in to get paid the accounting
system we use to move the money around
those things fall under us and what
we've been doing this last couple years

we inherited 30 different email systems

say what value are you adding running

security has to be critical absolute
yeah and and we found that the workloads

partners we have monthly business

they also try to spend just as much time

what's getting in their way and you know
what business problems are they trying

help marry the problems with the
solutions whoever's providing those to
start getting those wins we're gonna get
credibility as a problem solver and
they're gonna come back to us for other

CIO has never visited me before but like
I'm here because hey if you tell me my

started you know we had to then listen

but once we were able to do that we
started seeing some successes but again
we're not doing it alone we're doing it
with a lot of great partners
so along those lines how do you keep the
business teams then-current
on technology trends we created a team
called business engineering because we
believe there are no IT projects there
are only business projects with an IT
component right and we brought everybody
together that was in that kind of
customer facing role and we said your

to this flock of agencies what are these
customers need
where are they struggling what's coming
up what are they thinking about and how

helping them get better technology in

understand what solutions are out there
so we try to bring in vendors that we
